definition: to go to jail/to be sent to prison
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
lit. to get shackled and thrown in jail (idiom)/fig. to be put behind bars/to get jailed

sentences.english: Bronco was a bodybuilding champion who was imprisoned for murdering his wife.
sentences.chinese: 布兰槿是一个健美冠军，他因谋杀妻子而入狱。

sentences.english: I am suffering from AIDS because of drug abuse, and imprisonment because of drug-related crime.
sentences.chinese: 我因为吸毒患上艾滋病，也因为涉毒犯罪入狱。

sentences.english: The children of Kim Dae-jung and Kim Young-sam went to jail for graft.
sentences.chinese: 金大中及金泳三的孩子都曾因受贿而入狱。

sentences.english: He was then taken to the Allegheny County Jail.
sentences.chinese: 其后他被送到阿利根尼县入狱。

sentences.english: Except most of them were in for murder.
sentences.chinese: 除了他们大多数都是因为谋杀入狱。

sentences.english: Some even press criminal charges, which can result in jail time.
sentences.chinese: 一些雇主甚至坚持刑事诉讼，盗窃者将因此被捕入狱。

sentences.english: Mr. Eberling is in prison for the 1984 murder of an elderly widow.
sentences.chinese: 埃伯林由于在1984年谋杀一个老年寡妇而入狱。

sentences.english: She served a year in jail for her role in a fraudulent Enron tax return.
sentences.chinese: 她因为安然税收欺诈案被判入狱1年。

sentences.english: The next day, Zapa is imprisoned for being responsible of robbing the place.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，扎巴就因为偷窃罪被捕入狱。

sentences.english: Ona has faced freats threats of a rest arrest and prison for his efforts.
sentences.chinese: 为此，欧纳先生面临着逮捕和入狱的威胁。

sentences.english: They were reimprisoned for causing a disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 他们因制造动乱而再次入狱。

sentences.english: The fellow who was suspected of killing his wife was finally hurled into prison.
sentences.chinese: 那个涉嫌杀害其妻的家伙最终被迫入狱。

sentences.english: Ms. Gibbons, 54, has been in jail since Sunday, and Mr.
sentences.chinese: 现年54岁的吉布思女士，自周日开始入狱。

sentences.english: He was accused of graft and embezzlement and was chained and thrown into prison.
sentences.chinese: 他因被指控贪污盗窃而锒铛入狱。

definition: lit. to get shackled and thrown in jail (idiom)/fig. to be put behind bars/to get jailed
to imprison/to jail/to take into custody
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
to be wronged/to be subjected to an injustice
